key_work.title: Natural Light
key_work.brief_description: John Constable created close studies of nature and the changing effects of the sky. Together with JMW Turner, he transformed the genre of landscape painting in England, while younger artist John Linnell rejected bucolic scenes, recording the world as accurately as possible.

end.title: Frida
end.creator_credit: Julie Taymor, Joy Polstein, Lindsay Flickinger, Lizz Speed, Nancy Hardin, Roberto Sneider, Salma Hayek, Sarah Green, Miramax Films and Ventanarosa Productions
end.brief_description: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years, as we watch Frida’s journey to become a recognised artist in her own right.

constellations_other.name: From gallery to screen
constellations_other.description: Explore how famous films, videogames and music videos have taken their cue from the art of the past.

links.description: Photography not only influenced the cinematography of Carol but is also key to the narrative as protagonist Therese is a photographer. Although the biopic, Frida focused on Kahlo’s career as a painter, she also worked in photography throughout her lifetime.

end.title: Loving Vincent
end.creator_credit: Hugh Welchman and Sean M. Bobbitt
end.brief_description: The film brings the paintings of Vincent van Gogh to life to tell his remarkable story. Every one of the 65,000 frames of the film is an oil-painting hand-painted by 125 professional oil-painters from all across the world.

constellations_other.name: From gallery to screen
constellations_other.description: Explore how famous films, videogames and music videos have taken their cue from the art of the past.

links.description: Several of Kahlo’s paintings were recreated in Frida by building sets in forced perspective and using flattened lighting. Similarly, direct recreations of Vincent van Gogh’s artworks were amongst the 65,000 oil paintings featured in the stop-motion animation Loving Vincent.

end.title: Okami
end.brief_description: Okami is an action-adventure video game developed by Clover Studio and published by Capcom.

constellations_other.name: From gallery to screen
constellations_other.description: Explore how famous films, videogames and music videos have taken their cue from the art of the past.

links.description: Ukiyo-e woodblock prints were a key influence on Vincent van Gogh’s paintings, which are recreated in Loving Vincent. Similarly, the creators of Ōkami drew on the Ukiyo-e style of art to create the visuals for their videogame.

start.title: Barry Lyndon
start.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick, Milena Canonero, Ulla-Britt Söderlund, Hawk Films, Peregrine, Warner Bros. Pictures and Ken Adam
start.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1975
start.brief_description: An Irish rogue uses his cunning and wit to work his way up the social classes of 18th century England, transforming himself from the humble Redmond Barry into the noble Barry Lyndon.

constellations_other.name: From gallery to screen
constellations_other.description: Explore how famous films, videogames and music videos have taken their cue from the art of the past.

constellations_other.name: Painting pictures
constellations_other.description: Painter and photographer Louis Le Prince was inspired to develop the technology to make animated pictures by the circular panoramic paintings of his friends. His films captured everyday life and alluded to his artistic vision for cinema.

links.description: As Kubrick looked to 18th-century paintings for Barry Lyndon, director Todd Haynes similarly looked to female photographers of the era when making Carol. Photographers that inspired the film’s visual aesthetic included Ruth Orkin and Esther Bubley.

links.description: John Constable’s landscapes, as well as other 18th-century paintings, were a key influence on the cinematography of Stanley Kubrick’s Barry Lyndon. These paintings inspired how shots were framed, as well as how light appeared in the film.
